name: badness
content:
badness noun [U]
(EVIL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being evil or morally unacceptable: There is goodness and badness in everyone. Is this a case of badness or madness?
More examplesFewer examplesWe can define "moral" as being concerned with the judgment of the goodness or badness of human action and character.The casino is associated with money-laundering and other badness.the father who fears he's passed his badness onto his childrenShe never saw any badness in anyone.

badness noun [U]
(LOW QUALITY)
the fact of being very low in quality: I was amazed by the sheer badness of the film. He wrote poetry, known for its badness.
More examplesFewer examplesThis would be fine if the movie's badness was played for laughs, but it's not.The very badness of these books reminds us of other, better books.The badness of the painting is deliberate.

badness noun [U]
(SEVERE OR HARMFUL)
the quality of being severe, harmful, or unpleasant: Can you rate the badness of the pain on a scale from 1 to 10? I couldn't believe the badness of the weather.
More examplesFewer examplesWhatever we do, there are bad consequences, but you have to judge the relative badness of all the consequences.Each hurricane has its own brand of badness. According to this principle, the rightness or wrongness of an act is determined by the goodness or badness of its results.He seemed amazed at the badness of his own drunken condition.
